title: create a Hawaiian server
body: hello everyone, I would like to suggest to you today that Riot is establishing a Hawaiian server to the West Coast of the USA, the Hawaiian and all those who have too much ping the Oceanic server, the example of europe serrveur Eastern and Western Europe. thank you for sharing your opinions.{{item:3070}}

replies.body: It sucks to have to be stuck with a bunch of relatively bad ping options for servers. Unfortunately, the playerbase that such a server would, er... serve... is far too small to be worthwhile. This is the whole reason that East and West NA servers weren't the solution for NA as a whole, too. A lot of people don't realize it, but Europe's total population is about 200 Million higher than North America's. That is a large part of why it was viable to split Europe into two servers.

I understand that, but I'm not just talking about the person of Hawaii, I also speak to other people in the Oceania, the Pacific server because there is a lot of lag, that's why I propose has the comunity if they agree, then Riot judge for themselves, thank you for your understanding.

A server in Hawaii would serve absolutely nobody other than folks in Hawaii. It's almost 2400 miles from the nearest point in California (mind you that is only 300 miles less than the width of the entire continental united states). Californians would still have better ping to the new Chicago servers. It's almost double that distance to Australia, so it wouldn't serve them well, either. And at 3800 miles from Japan, it won't help them at all.

Thank you, voice of reason.

Sure a server in every household would be ideal, but frankly a hawaiian server is highly impractical from a macro-view.  Sorry to be negative, but i wouldn't cross your fingers on this one.

I lived in Hawaii for a year and my ping was always in the 90s playing on the NA server. If you're seeing higher then that then it's probably an issue with your connection, not Riot.

Furthermore, I don't think there's enough players on the islands to warrant a new server. It's a pretty huge cost both for hardware and maintenence. On top of this, the low player base would result in long queue times or unfair matchmaking.

There's a lot of players in French Polynesia, and good ones even (I know some are master rank).
The lowest ping we can have is around 120 (and that was before the server moved).
It was mostly because of our bad internet provider at first, but even now that we have a fiber optic connection (from Hawaii), it's still really high.
I personally play with 220pings, and that's on a good day.

We can't play on OCE either because our ping on this server is actually higher than on NA (I have an account on OCE).
Turkey has a server, there's a South East Asia serve too, and Japan is getting a server apparently too.

There are A LOT more gamers in South East Asia, Turkey, and Japan then in French Polynesia.  Believe me, if the player base was there Riot would do it.  If they tried to do it now the queue times would be insanely long and the match making would be infuriating.

There's not only French Polynesia in the Pacific.
But indeed, a different server wouldn't work because of the number of player.

Having some kind of relay or moving the server back to the West Coast would help us more.
Or improve OCE then, because I started playing on it when it was still beta and it's still not very enjoyable..
I think upgrading or relocating the OCE server is the best bet.

I must agree. My average ping is about 170 after the servers were changed.

I doubt there is a large enough population to make a Hawaiian Server worth it.

However, there is a large enough population to make a west coast server worth.

A Hawaiian server would help us in the Pacific, while on a West Coast server, we would still have a relatively high ping.
I live in French Polynesia, the lowest ping you could get was 120 and that's when the server was still in LA.
Now that the server moved to Chicago, it's at least 180, and that's on good days.

I personally play with at least 220pings.
And on OCE it's even worse.

Yeah, and a server in Oregon would help us on the West Coast out, while a Hawaiian server would do little to nothing.

And while there is a "lot" of players in Polynesia, there's even more on the west coast.

There's a much bigger difference between the ping you get on the West Coast than the ping you get in the Pacific area.
I lived on the East Coast for a while (2 years) and visited the West Coast several time before, and the ping was much lower than what I have now.
(60 on the West Coast and 110 on the East Coast before the server moved)

So you can put can put a server in Hawaii, which would probably be used only Polynesia minus New Zealand. That's a population of about 2 million people.

Or you can put a server on the west coast, which will serve pretty much everything west of the Rockies, including Polynesia, which is a population of about 65 million. Not to mention a west coast server will be cheaper per person, because we have power and space, two things that are hard to find on an island.
